products.label: Tutorial Basic
products.name: test-da
products.short_description: Creates a secure infrastructure with virtual servers to run your workloads on a VPC network
products.long_description: The VSI on VPC landing zone provides secure and customizable compute resources for running your applications and services. It creates secure and compliant Virtual Server Instances (VSI) on top of an existing Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network.

flavors.label: Standard
flavors.name: standard
flavors.usage:
module "landing-zone" {
  source           = "https://cm.globalcatalog.cloud.ibm.com/api/v1-beta/offering/source//${{workingDirectory}}?archive=tgz&flavor=${{flavor}}&kind=terraform&name=${{name}}&version=${{version}}"
  ibmcloud_api_key = var.ibmcloud_api_key
  ssh_public_key   = var.ssh_public_key
  region           = "us-south"
  prefix           = "slz"
}

features.title: Virtual Server Instances for every subnet
Reduces failure events by using multizone regions
Collects and stores Internet Protocol (IP) traffic information with Activity Tracker and Flow Logs
Securely connects to multiple networks with a site-to-site virtual private network
Simplifies risk management and demonstrates regulatory compliance with Financial Services
Uses an edge VPC for secure access through the public internet
Uses Floating IP address for access through the public internet

diagram.caption: VSI on VPC landing zone - Standard variation

diagrams.description: The Standard variation of the VSI on VPC landing zone deployable architecture is based on the IBM Cloud for Financial Services reference architecture. The architecture creates a customizable and secure infrastructure, with virtual servers, to run your workloads with a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) in multizone regions.

configuration.description: Region where VPC will be created. To find your VPC region, use `ibmcloud is regions` command to find available regions.

A unique identifier for resources. Must begin with a lowercase letter and end with a lowerccase letter or number. This prefix will be prepended to any resources provisioned by this template. Prefixes must be 16 or fewer characters.
